Description: Body and handle sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; glaze mostly fired orange-brown; white slip; interior glazed with two added white bands preserved; exterior: on wall above the handle zone, trace of filling ornament on left, part of vertical maeander pattern dividing band central and part of large maeander square on right; below, handle zone framed by pairs of bands; in handle zone, handle frill pattern around handle roots; handle glazed; below on cul, hook maeanders between wide bands.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0100) (phase 2)
